intro: Dischidia spironema, commonly known as the spiral leaf dischidia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its unique, spiraling growth pattern of its leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by elliptical, yellowish fruits. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found growing on trees or rocks. Its foliage is thick and waxy, making it an attractive ornamental plant.
